16.verse: You have not chosen me, but I have chosen you, and ordained you, that you should go and bring forth fruit, and that your fruit should endure; that whatever you ask of the Father in my name, he should give it to you.

17.verse: This I command you: love one another.

18.verse: If the world hates you, you know that it hated me before it hated you.

19.verse: If you were of the world, the world would love its own. However because you are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.

20.verse: Remember the saying that I said to you: the servant is not greater than his lord. If they have persecuted me, so will they persecute you. If they have kept my sayings, so will they keep yours.

21.verse: But they will do all these things to you for my name’s sake, because they have not known him who sent me.

22.verse: If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not have had sin. But now they have nothing to cloak their sin with.

23.verse: He who hates me, hates my Father.

24.verse: If I had not done works among them which no other man did, they would not have sin. But now they have seen, and yet have hated both me and my Father,

25.verse: even so that the saying is fulfilled that is written in their law: They hated me without a cause.

26.verse: But when the Comforter is come, whom I will send to you from the Father, which is the Spirit of truth who proceeds of the Father, he will testify of me.

27.verse: And you shall bear witness also, because you have been with me from the beginning.

1.verse: Consolation for trouble. Prayers are heard through Christ. These things I have said to you so that you are not made to stumble.

2.verse: They will excommunicate you; yea, the time shall come that whoever kills you will think that he does God service.

3.verse: And such things they will do to you because they have not known the Father nor me.

4.verse: But I have told you these things so that when that hour comes, you may remember them, that I told you so.  I did not say these things to you at the beginning, because I was present with you.

5.verse: But now I go my way to him who sent me, and none of you asks me, Where are you going?

6.verse: But because I have said such things to you, your hearts are full of sorrow.

7.verse: Nevertheless, I tell you the truth: it is better for you that I go away. For if I do not go away, the Comforter will not come to you. But if I depart, I will send him to you.

8.verse: And when he is come, he will rebuke the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment:

9.verse: of sin, because they do not believe on me;

10.verse: of righteousness, because I go to my Father and you will see me no more;

11.verse: and of judgment, because the chief ruler of this world is judged already.

12.verse: I have yet many things to say to you, but you cannot receive them now.

13.verse: However, when he is come (I mean the Spirit of truth), he will lead you into all truth. He will not speak of himself, but whatever he hears, that he will speak, and he will show you things to come.

14.verse: He will glorify me, for he will receive of mine and will show it to you.

15.verse: All things that the Father has are mine. Therefore I said to you that he will take of mine and show it to you.

16.verse: After a while you will not see me, and again after a while you will see me, because I go to the Father.

17.verse: Then some of his disciples said between themselves, What is this that he says to us, After a while you will not see me, and again after a while you will see me? and, Because I go to the Father?

18.verse: They said therefore, What is this that he says, After a while? We cannot understand what he says.

19.verse: Jesus perceived that they wanted to question him and said to them, You enquire about this between yourselves, that I said, After a while you will not see me, and again after a while you will see me.

20.verse: Truly truly I say to you, you will weep and lament, and the world will rejoice. You will sorrow; but your sorrow will be turned to joy.

21.verse: A woman when she travails has sorrow, because her hour is come. But as soon as she is delivered of the child, she remembers no more the anguish, for joy that a man is born into the world.

22.verse: And you now are in sorrow. But I will see you again, and your hearts will rejoice, and no one will take your joy from you.

23.verse: And in that day you will ask me no question. Truly truly I say to you, whatever you ask the Father in my name, he will give you.

24.verse: Until now you have asked nothing in my name. Ask, and you will receive, so that your joy may be full.

25.verse: These things I have spoken to you in parables. The time will come when I will speak no more to you in figures, but I will show you plainly from my Father.

26.verse: At that day, you will ask in my name. And I say not to you that I will speak to my Father for you.

27.verse: For the Father himself loves you, because you have loved me and have believed that I came out from God.

28.verse: I went out from the Father and came into the world, and I leave the world again and go to the Father.

29.verse: His disciples said to him, Lo, now you speak plainly, and you use no parable.

30.verse: Now we know that you understand all things, and there is no need for anyone to ask you any question. Therefore we believe that you came from God.

31.verse: Jesus answered them, Now you do believe.

32.verse: Behold, the hour draws near, and is already come, that you shall be scattered every man his ways, and will leave me alone. And yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.

33.verse: These words I have spoken to you so that in me you may have peace. For in the world you will have tribulation. But be of good cheer: I have overcome the world.

1.verse: The most hearty and loving prayer of Christ to his Father for all those who receive the truth. These words Jesus spoke, and lifted up his eyes to heaven and said, Father, the hour is come. Glorify your Son so that your Son may glorify you.

2.verse: For you have given him power over all flesh, so that he may give eternal life to as many as you have given him.

3.verse: This is life eternal: to know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ whom you have sent.

4.verse: I have glorified you on the earth. I have finished the work that you gave me to do.

5.verse: And now glorify me, Father, with your own self – with the glory that I had with you before the world was.

6.verse: I have declared your name to the men that you gave me out of the world. Yours they were, and you gave them to me, and they have kept your sayings.

7.verse: Now they know that all things, whatsoever you have given me, are of you.

8.verse: For I have given to them the words that you gave me, and they have received them, and know surely that I came out from you, and do believe that you did send me.

9.verse: I pray for them – and pray not for the world, but for those whom you have given me. For they are yours.

10.verse: And all mine are yours, and yours are mine, and I am glorified in them.

11.verse: And now I am no longer in the world, but they are in the world, and I come to you. Holy Father, keep in your own name those whom you have given me so that they may be one, as we are.

12.verse: While I was with them in the world, I kept them in your name. Those whom you gave me I have kept, and none of them is lost except that lost child, so that the scripture may be fulfilled.

13.verse: Now I come to you. And I speak these words in the world so that they may have my joy full in them.

14.verse: I have given them your words. And the world has hated them, because they are not of the world, just as I am not of the world.

15.verse: I ask not that you take them out of the world, but that you keep them from evil.

16.verse: They are not of the world, as I am not of the world.

17.verse: Sanctify them with your truth. Your word is truth.

18.verse: As you sent me into the world, so have I sent them into the world.

19.verse: And for their sakes I sanctify myself, so that they also may be sanctified through the truth.

20.verse: I pray not for them alone, but also for those who will believe on me through their preaching:

21.verse: that they all may be one, as you, Father, are in me, and I in you; that they may also be one in us, so that the world may believe that you have sent me.

22.verse: And the glory that you gave me, I have given them, so that they may be one as we are one,

23.verse: I in them and you in me, so that they may be made perfect in one, and so that the world may know that you have sent me, and have loved them as you have loved me.

24.verse: Father, I will that those whom you have given me be with me where I am, that they may see the glory that you have given me. For you loved me before the making of the world.

25.verse: O righteous Father, the very world has not known you, but I have known you, and these have known that you have sent me.

26.verse: And I have declared to them your name, and will declare it, so that the love with which you have loved me may be in them, and so that I may be in them.

1.verse: Christ is betrayed. The words of his mouth smite the officers to the ground. Peter strikes off Malchus’ ear. Jesus is brought before Annas, Caiaphas, and Pilate. When Jesus had spoken these words, he went forth with his disciples over the brook Kidron, where there was a garden into which he entered with his disciples.

2.verse: Judas who betrayed him also knew the place, for Jesus often resorted there with his disciples.

3.verse: Judas then, after he had received a band of men, and officers of the high priests and Pharisees, went there with lanterns and firebrands and weapons.

4.verse: Then Jesus, knowing all things that would come on him, went forth and said to them, Whom do you seek?

5.verse: They answered him, Jesus of Nazareth. Jesus said to them, I am he. Judas who betrayed him also stood with them.

6.verse: But as soon as Jesus had said to them, I am he, they went backwards and fell to the ground.

7.verse: And he asked them again, Whom do you seek? They said, Jesus of Nazareth.

8.verse: Jesus answered, I said to you, I am he. If you seek me, let these go their way.

9.verse: This was to fulfil the saying that he had spoken: Of those whom you gave me, I have not lost one.

10.verse: Simon Peter had a sword, and drew it and struck the high priest’s servant, and cut off his right ear. The servant’s name was Malchus.

11.verse: Then Jesus said to Peter, Put up your sword into the sheath. Shall I not drink of the cup which my Father has given me?

12.verse: Then the company of men and the captain and the officers of the Jews took Jesus and bound him,

13.verse: and led him away to Annas first. For he was the father-in-law of Caiaphas, who was the high priest that same year.

14.verse: Caiaphas was the one who gave counsel to the Jews that it was good that one man should die for the people.

15.verse: And Simon Peter followed Jesus, and so did another disciple. That disciple was known to the high priest, and went in with Jesus into the palace of the high priest.

16.verse: But Peter stood at the door outside. Then that other disciple, who was known to the high priest, went out and spoke to the maid that kept the door, and brought Peter in.

17.verse: Then the maid that kept the door said to Peter, Are you not one of this man’s disciples? He said, I am not.

18.verse: The servants and the officers were standing there, and had made a fire of coals, for it was cold and they were warming themselves. Peter also stood among them and warmed himself.

19.verse: The high priest asked Jesus about his disciples and about his teaching.

20.verse: Jesus answered him, I spoke openly in the world. I always taught in the synagogue and in the temple where all the Jews come together, and in secret I have said nothing.

21.verse: Why do you ask me? Ask those who heard me what I said to them. They can tell what I said.

22.verse: When he had thus spoken, one of the officers who stood by struck Jesus on the face, saying, Is this how you answer the high priest?

23.verse: Jesus answered him, If I have spoken wrongly, bear witness of the wrong. If I have spoken well, why do you hit me?

24.verse: And Annas sent him bound to Caiaphas, the high priest.

25.verse: Simon Peter was standing and warming himself, and they said to him, Are you not also one of his disciples? He denied it and said, I am not.

26.verse: One of the servants of the high priest (a relative of the man whose ear Peter cut off) said to him, Did I not see you in the garden with him?

27.verse: Peter denied it again; and immediately, the cock crew.

28.verse: Then they led Jesus from Caiaphas into the hall of judgment. It was the morning, and they themselves did not go into the judgment hall lest they should be defiled, but so that they could eat the Passover lamb.

29.verse: Pilate then went out to them and said, What accusation do you bring against this man?

30.verse: They answered and said to him, If he were not an evil-doer, we would not have delivered him to you.

31.verse: Then Pilate said to them, You take him and judge him according to your own law. Then the Jews said to him, It is not lawful for us to put any man to death.

32.verse: This was to fulfil the words of Jesus, which he spoke signifying how he would die.

33.verse: Then Pilate entered into the judgment hall again, and called Jesus and said to him, Are you the king of the Jews?

34.verse: Jesus answered, Do you say that of yourself, or did others tell you this about me?

35.verse: Pilate answered, Am I a Jew? Your own nation and high priests have delivered you to me. What have you done?

36.verse: Jesus answered, My kingdom is not of this world. If my kingdom were of this world, then my servants would surely fight so that I would not be delivered to the Jews. But now my kingdom is not from here.

37.verse: Pilate said to him, Are you a king then? Jesus answered, You say rightly that I am a king. For this cause I was born, and for this cause I came into the world: that I should bear witness to the truth. And all who are of the truth hear my voice.

38.verse: Pilate said to him, What is truth? And when he had said that, Pilate went out again to the Jews and said to them, I find in him no fault at all.

39.verse: You have a custom that I should set one prisoner free to you at Passover. Do you want me to release to you the king of the Jews?

40.verse: Then they all cried out again, saying, Not him, but Barabbas! Now that Barabbas was a robber.

1.verse: Christ is crucified. He commits his mother to John’s care, sheds his blood, and is buried. Then Pilate took Jesus and scourged him.

2.verse: And the soldiers wound a crown of thorns and put it on his head. And they put on him a purple garment,

3.verse: and said, Hail, King of the Jews! And they struck him on the face.

4.verse: Pilate went forth again and said to the people, Look, I am bringing him out to you so that you may know that I find no fault in him.

5.verse: Then Jesus came forth wearing the crown of thorns and the robe of purple. And Pilate said to them, Behold the man!

6.verse: When the high priests and officers saw him, they cried out, saying, Crucify him, crucify him! Pilate said to them, You take him and crucify him, for I find no fault in him.

7.verse: The Jews answered him, We have a law, and by our law he ought to die, because he made himself the Son of God.

8.verse: When Pilate heard these words, he was the more afraid,

9.verse: and went again into the judgment hall and said to Jesus, Where are you from? But Jesus gave him no answer.

10.verse: Then Pilate said to him, Will you not speak to me? Do you not know that I have the power to crucify you, and have the power to set you free?

11.verse: Jesus answered, You could have no power at all against me unless it were given you from above. Therefore he who delivered me to you is more in sin.

12.verse: And from then on Pilate sought means to release him. But the Jews cried out, saying, If you let him go, you are not Caesar’s friend! For whoever makes himself a king, is against Caesar.

13.verse: When Pilate heard that saying, he brought Jesus forth and sat down to give sentence in a place called The Pavement, but in the Hebrew tongue, Gabbatha.

14.verse: It was the day before the Sabbath that falls in the Passover feast, and about the sixth hour. And he said to the Jews, Behold your king!

15.verse: They cried, Away with him, away with him, crucify him! Pilate said to them, Shall I crucify your king? The high priests answered, We have no king but Caesar.

16.verse: Then Pilate delivered him to them, to be crucified.

17.verse: And they took Jesus and led him away. And he bore his cross, and went out to a place called the Place of Dead Men’s Skulls, which is named in Hebrew, Golgotha.

18.verse: There they crucified him, and two others with him, one on either side, and Jesus in the middle.

19.verse: And Pilate wrote his title and put it on the cross. The writing was, JESUS OF NAZARETH, KING OF THE JEWS.

20.verse: Many of the Jews read this title, because the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city. And it was written in Hebrew, Greek, and Latin.

21.verse: Then the high priests of the Jews said to Pilate, Do not write King of the Jews, but that he said, I am King of the Jews.

22.verse: Pilate answered, What I have written, I have written.

23.verse: Then the soldiers, when they had crucified Jesus, took his garments and made four parts, to every soldier a part; and also his coat. The coat was without seam, woven throughout,

24.verse: and they said to one another, Let us not tear it, but cast lots who should have it. This was to fulfil the scripture that says: They parted my garments among them, and for my coat did cast lots.

25.verse: And the soldiers did such things indeed. Then there stood by the cross of Jesus his mother, and his mother’s sister Mary, the wife of Cleophas, and Mary Magdalene.

26.verse: When Jesus saw his mother and the disciple whom he loved standing by, he said to his mother, Woman, behold your son.

27.verse: Then he said to the disciple, Behold your mother. And from that hour, the disciple took her for his own.

28.verse: After that, when Jesus perceived that all things were performed, so that the scripture would be fulfilled, he said, I thirst!

29.verse: There was standing nearby a vessel full of vinegar, and they filled a sponge with vinegar, and wound it about with hyssop, and put it to his mouth.

30.verse: As soon as Jesus had received of the vinegar, he said, It is finished! And he bowed his head and gave up the spirit.

31.verse: The Jews then, because it was the day before the Sabbath, in order that the bodies should not remain upon the cross on the Sabbath day (for that Sabbath day was a high day), requested Pilate that their legs might be broken and that they might be taken down.

32.verse: Then the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first man and of the other that was crucified with Jesus.

33.verse: But when they came to Jesus and saw that he was dead already, they did not break his legs.

34.verse: But one of the soldiers thrust him in the side with a spear, and immediately there came out blood and water.

35.verse: And he who saw it has borne witness, and his testimony is true. And he knows that he speaks the truth, so that you may believe also.

36.verse: These things were done so that the scripture would be fulfilled: Not one of his bones shall be broken.

37.verse: And again another scripture says: They shall look on him whom they pierced.

38.verse: After that, Joseph of Arimathea (who was a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews) asked Pilate if he could take down the body of Jesus. And Pilate gave him permission.

39.verse: And Nicodemus came also, who at the beginning had gone to Jesus by night, and brought myrrh and aloes mingled together, about a hundred pound weight.

40.verse: Then they took the body of Jesus and wound it in linen cloths with the spices, as the custom of the Jews is to bury.

41.verse: And in the place where Jesus was crucified was a garden, and in the garden a new sepulchre, in which no man had ever been laid.

42.verse: There they laid Jesus, because of the Jews’ Sabbath eve. For the sepulchre was near at hand.

1.verse: The resurrection of Christ, who appears to Mary Magdalene and to all his disciples, to their great comfort. The morrow after the Sabbath day, Mary Magdalene came early to the sepulchre when it was still dark, and saw the stone taken away from the tomb.

2.verse: Then she ran and went to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple whom Jesus loved, and said to them, They have taken away the Lord out of the tomb, and we do not know where they have laid him.

3.verse: Peter went out, and that other disciple, and came to the sepulchre.

4.verse: They ran both together, and the other disciple outran Peter and came first to the sepulchre.

5.verse: And he stooped down and saw the linen cloths lying there, but did not go in.

6.verse: Then came Simon Peter following him, and went into the sepulchre and saw the linen cloths lying there,

7.verse: and the cloth that had been around his head not lying with the linen cloth, but wrapped together in a place by itself.

8.verse: Then that other disciple went in also, who had come first to the sepulchre; and he saw and believed.

9.verse: For as yet they did not know the scriptures, that he must rise again from death.

10.verse: And the disciples went away again to their own homes.

11.verse: Mary stood outside at the sepulchre, weeping. And as she wept, she bowed herself into the sepulchre

12.verse: and saw two angels in white sitting, the one at the head and the other at the feet where they had laid the body of Jesus.

13.verse: And they said to her, Woman, why do you weep? She said to them, Because they have taken away my Lord and I do not know where they have laid him.

14.verse: When she had said this, she turned herself back and saw Jesus standing, but did not know that it was Jesus.

15.verse: Jesus said to her, Woman, why do you weep? Whom are you seeking? She, supposing he was a gardener, said to him, Sir, if you have carried him away, tell me where you have laid him so that I may get him.

16.verse: Jesus said to her, Mary! She turned herself about and said to him, Rabboni! (which is to say, Teacher!).

17.verse: Jesus said to her, Do not touch me, for I am not yet ascended to my Father. But go to my brethren and say to them, I am ascending to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.

18.verse: Mary Magdalene went and told the disciples that she had seen the Lord, and that he had spoken such things to her.

19.verse: The same day at night, which was the day after the Sabbath day, when the doors were shut where the disciples were assembled together for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in their midst and said to them, Peace be with you.

20.verse: And when he had so said, he showed to them his hands and his side. Then were the disciples glad, when they saw the Lord.

21.verse: Then Jesus said to them again, Peace be with you. As my Father sent me, so I also send you.

22.verse: And when he had said that, he breathed on them and said to them, Receive the Holy Spirit.

23.verse: Whosever sins you remit, they are remitted to them, and whosever sins you retain, they are retained.

24.verse: But Thomas (called Didymus), one of the twelve, was not with them when Jesus came.

25.verse: The other disciples said to him, We have seen the Lord! And he said to them, Unless I see in his hands the print of the nails, and put my finger in the marks of the nails, and put my hand into his side, I will not believe.

26.verse: And after eight days his disciples were again inside, and Thomas with them. Then Jesus came when the doors were shut and stood in their midst and said, Peace be with you.

27.verse: After that he said to Thomas, Bring your finger here, and see my hands, and bring your hand and put it into my side; and be not faithless, but believing.

28.verse: Thomas answered and said to him, My Lord and my God!

29.verse: Jesus said to him, Thomas, because you have seen me, therefore you believe. Happy are those who have not seen and yet believe!

30.verse: And Jesus did many other signs in the presence of his disciples, which are not written in this book.

31.verse: These are written so that you may believe that Jesus is Christ, the Son of God, and so that in believing you may have life through his name.

1.verse: He appears to his disciples again by the Sea of Tiberias, and commands Peter earnestly to feed his sheep. After that, Jesus showed himself again to the disciples at the Sea of Tiberias. And this is how he showed himself:

2.verse: there were together Simon Peter, and Thomas who is called Didymus, and Nathanael of Cana (a town of Galilee), and the sons of Zebedee, and two others of the disciples.

3.verse: Simon Peter said to them, I’m going fishing. They said to him, We also will go with you. They went their way and entered into a boat straightaway, and that night they caught nothing.

4.verse: But when the morning was now come, Jesus stood on the shore. Nevertheless, the disciples did not know that it was Jesus.

5.verse: Jesus said to them, Sirs, do you have any fish? They answered him, No.

6.verse: And he said to them, Cast out the net on the right side of the boat and you will find some. They cast out, and then they were not able to draw the net in for the number of fishes.

7.verse: Then the disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter, It is the Lord! When Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he girded his mantle to him (for he had stripped down), and sprang into the sea.

8.verse: The other disciples came by boat – for they were not far from land, but about a hundred yards – and they drew in the net with fishes.

9.verse: As soon as they had come to land they saw hot coals, and fish laid on them, and bread.

10.verse: Jesus said to them, Bring some of the fish that you have now caught.

11.verse: Simon Peter stepped forth and drew the net to land full of great fishes, a hundred and fifty-three. And for all there were so many, yet the net was not torn.

12.verse: Jesus said to them, Come and eat. And none of the disciples ventured to ask him, Who are you? because they knew that it was the Lord.

13.verse: Jesus then came and took bread and gave it to them, and the fish likewise.

14.verse: And this is now the third time that Jesus appeared to his disciples after he was risen again from death.

15.verse: When they had eaten, Jesus said to Simon Peter, Simon son of Jonah, do you love me more than these? He said to him, Yes, Lord, you know that I love you. Jesus said to him, Feed my lambs.

16.verse: He said to him again the second time, Simon son of Jonah, do you love me? He said to him, Yes, Lord, you know that I love you. Jesus said to him, Feed my sheep.

17.verse: He said to him the third time, Simon, do you love me? And Peter sorrowed because he said to him the third time, Do you love me? And he said to him, Lord, you know all things. You know that I love you. Jesus said to him, Feed my sheep.

18.verse: Truly truly I say to you, when you were young, you girded yourself and walked where you wished. But when you are old, you will stretch forth your hands, and another will gird you and lead you where you do not wish.

19.verse: He spoke this signifying by what death Peter would glorify God. And when he had said this, he said to him, Follow me.

20.verse: Peter turned about and saw the disciple whom Jesus loved following, who also had leaned on his breast at supper and said, Lord, who is it that will betray you?

21.verse: When Peter saw him he said to Jesus, Lord, what about this man?

22.verse: Jesus said to him, If I desire him to remain till I come, what is that to you? Follow me.

23.verse: Then there went out a saying among the brethren that that disciple would not die. But Jesus did not say to him that he would not die, but, If I desire him to remain till I come, what is that to you?

24.verse: The same disciple is he who testifies of these things and wrote these things. And we know that his testimony is true.

25.verse: There are also many other things that Jesus did, which, if they were written every one, I suppose the world could not contain the books that would be written. Here ends the gospel of Saint John.
